newsitem.title: USA: Hashimoto says U.S. bond holdings rely on steady fx rates.
newsitem.headline: Hashimoto says U.S. bond holdings rely on steady fx rates.

text.p: Japan's Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto said stable exchange rates are critical to Japan maintaining its holdings of U.S. government securities.

"I hope the U.S. will engage in efforts and in cooperation to maintain exchange stability so we will not succumb to the temptation to sell off Treasury bills and switch our funds to gold," Hashimoto said in a question-and-answer session following a speech carried live on Reuters Financial Television (RFTV).
Hashimoto was answering a question of whether it was in Japan's long-term interest to continue to accumulate U.S. government securities.
The Prime Minister's remark weighed on U.S. Treasury bonds and futures and pushed dollar/yen below 115 to near last Friday's closing level.
Meanwhile, gold was bolstered by the remark.
Hashimoto's address was to an audience at the Columbia University School of International and Public Affairs.
